subject: Attn: Sir/Madam,
body:
Attn: Sir/Madam,
                          RE-CHANGE OF ACCOUNT.
I have just been appointed into office in charge of the Banking & Payment System here in the Central Bank of Nigeria, to oversee all pending & overdue foreign payments and ensure that debts owed to all foreign beneficiaries from contract/inheritance/lottery winnings are completely paid. And I have therefore discovered that a new bank account has been submitted to divert your payment to a German bank as stated below:
FRANKFURTER BANK
A/C NO.: 367840545
SWIFT CODE: 50050201
BENEFICIARY: CERSTIN WENGER.
The new account was submitted with a letter stating that you have died, and have directed the new beneficiary to claim your fund. You are therefore required to urgently confirm if this development is true and has your authority. All arrangements to effect payment to the new bank account have been completed, but is kept pending until we hear from you.
Respond immediately with your full details, so that all perceived anomalies will be corrected, to ensure that we do not release your fund to the wrong persons.
Sincerely,
Victor Jonathan
Manager
Banking & Payment System
(Foreign Remittance Department)
Central Bank of Nigeria.

subject: Re:    Attn: Sir/Madam,
body:
Hello Victor Jonathan,

Wow, that's quite a surprise! I can assure you that I'm very much alive and well. It's strange to hear about this new bank account in Germany. I don't recall authorizing any such changes.

Could you please provide more details about this situation? How did the bank receive this information? And what steps are being taken to investigate this matter?

I appreciate your help in resolving this issue. Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Mary

subject: Acknowledgement & directives
body:
Attn: Sir/Ma,

Good that you are alive to claim your long overdue payment, and also save
us the embarrassment of making payment to a wrong person. We didn't believe
them, that's why we contacted you to seek this clarification.

It might interest you to note that my duty is to list/schedule this payment
which is in your name, and which is part of what I met in my office as my
statutory duties. So be informed that in handling your payment, we will
follow the due process thoroughly, to ensure that you, the bonafide
beneficiary, receive your payment without hitches.

We therefore confirm receipt of your full information/details for the
reconciliation of your file (DOCUMENTATION PROCESS). Already, your US$10.5M
fund has been approved and programmed to be paid to you via ATM CARD. We
will give you your Payment Approvals as soon as your details are confirmed.
And be informed also that you are not going to pay any further charges/fees
in Cost of Transfers (COT) for the release of your payment.

These fake claimants (I Nigerian and 2 foreign nationals) would surely be
apprended for prosecution when the report back in 2 weeks time, as gave
them time.

Sincerely,

Victor Jonathan
Assistant Director,
Banking & Payment System
(Foreign Remittance Department)
Central Bank of Nigeria.
*Tel: +234-913 886 1299*

subject: Re: Acknowledgement & directives
body:
Hello Victor Jonathan,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm glad to hear that there's a payment in my name, although I must admit, this comes as quite a surprise! Could you please provide more details about this? How did this payment come about and why is it in my name?

Also, could you explain the process of receiving the payment via an ATM card? I've never received a payment in this manner before.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Mary

subject: Forward your details
body:
Attn: Madam,

Good to hear from you again.

It is also very surprising to me hearing that you are surprised at this
payment in your name. As I explained to you earlier, this is part of what I
met on my table upon assumption of office. I couldn't have contacted you if
your name is not here as a fund beneficiary.

However, we must carry out a full verification between you and Cerstin
Wenger, before finally taking a decision. Yes, I contacted you, first for
the purpose of verifying the genuine beneficiary of the $10.5m, and
secondly to effect the payment upon a satisfactory verification of the
bonafide beneficiary. And that is between yourself and Cerstin Wenger who
has submitted information and documents of herself for proof.

So forward to us:
*Your full names
*Current/complete address
*Profession/Occupation
*Age
*Nationality
*Copy of your Driver's License/International Passport.

After the verification we will proceed to issue the ATM Card, and you will
duly be notified of the processes involved.

I am sending my ID Card and International Passport, as protocol demands,
for you to know me properly.

Sincerely,

Victor Jonathan
Manager
Banking & Payment System
(Foreign Remittance Department)
Central Bank of Nigeria.
*Tel: +234-913 886 1299*

subject: Re: Acknowledgement & directives
body:
Hello Victor Jonathan,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm glad to hear that there's a payment in my name. However, I'm a bit confused about the details. Could you please explain more about this overdue payment? How did it come about and why is it in my name?

Also, could you clarify what you mean by "ATM CARD"? Is this a physical card that will be sent to me or is it something else?

Lastly, I'm curious about these fake claimants you mentioned. Who are they and how did they get involved in this situation?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Mary

subject: Re: Forward your details
body:
Hello Victor Jonathan,

It's great to hear from you! I'm quite surprised about this payment in my name, it's not something I was expecting. 

You mentioned a verification process between me and Cerstin Wenger. Could you please elaborate more on that? What kind of verification is needed? And who exactly is Cerstin Wenger?

I appreciate your request for my personal details, but I'm afraid I can't provide them at the moment. Is there any other way we could proceed with this without sharing such information?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Mary
